alert.note: Alert for Pecos; Terrell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 7:09PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Pecos and northwestern Terrell Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 709 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles north of Sanderson, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Pecos and northwestern Terrell Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
